intro: Paraspalathus cerrhantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions. Its latex contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
